posts.title: One Method, Different Implementations
posts.description: We can set Func<>s as properties, so people can call them just like methods, and we can change the function from the constructor according to the user's needs. in this example, I am creating a class which has few methods to download data, the user of the class can decide whether they should cache the results or not

posts.title: Genie - An Efficient Way to Access Data
posts.description: Almost all the time we need a database to run our apps. most of the time, these databases are relational databases. as everyone knows we must use SQL to access these databases. writing an SQL query for every database call is a pain and no one does that these days. instead, we use something called ORMs (Object Relational Mappers). we can use an ORM to access databases without writing SQL or worrying about mapping relations to objects. there are a lot of ORM implementations for every popular language.
